mining

Class KMeansMiner

  • java.lang.Object
    • mining.KMeansMiner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class KMeansMiner
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that represents the action of "Mining" on a data table with KMeans algorithm, choosing number of clusters. This class, furthermore, allow to serialize on a file an instance of Mining.
    Author:
    Simone Cicerello
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KMeansMiner(int k)
      Constructs an instance of the KMeans miner with k clusters.
      KMeansMiner(java.lang.String fileName)
      Constructs an instance of the KMeans miner, loading from previously serialized file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ClusterSet getC()
      Getter of the clusterSet.
      int kmeans(Data data)
      Implements KMeans algorithm divided in three step: step 1) initializes the centroids by choosing k tuples randomly; step 2) iteratively, calculates and adds each other tuples to the nearests cluster, step 3) update new centroids;
      void salva(java.lang.String fileName)
      Serialize and save an instance of KMeans in a file.

        public ClusterSet getC()

      • kmeans

        public int kmeans(Data data)
           throws OutOfRangeSampleSize
        Implements KMeans algorithm divided in three step: step 1) initializes the centroids by choosing k tuples randomly; step 2) iteratively, calculates and adds each other tuples to the nearests cluster, step 3) update new centroids;
        Parameters:
        data - table
        Returns:
        number of iterations
        Throws:
        OutOfRangeSampleSize
